edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.server

Class JarvisServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.server.JarvisServer

  • public class JarvisServer
extends Object
    The REST server used to receive external webhooks.

    The JarvisServer provides a simple REST API that accepts POST methods on port 5000. Incoming requests are parsed and sent to the registered WebhookEventProviders, that transform the original request into EventInstances that can be used to trigger actions.

    See Also:
    registerWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider)

    • Field Detail

      • SERVER_PORT_KEY

        public static String SERVER_PORT_KEY
        The Configuration key to store the server port to use.

      • DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT

        protected static int DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT
        The default port to use.

        The server port can be customized in the constructor's Configuration using the SERVER_PORT_KEY key.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JarvisServer

        public JarvisServer(Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new JarvisServer with the given Configuration.

        The provided Configuration is used to specify the port the server should listen to (see SERVER_PORT_KEY). If the Configuration does not specify a port the default value (5000) is used.

        Note: this method does not start the underlying HttpServer. Use start() to start the HttpServer in a dedicated thread.

        Parameters:
        configuration - the Configuration used to initialize the JarvisServer
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided configuration is null
        See Also:
        start(), stop()

    • Method Detail

      • getHttpServer

        protected org.apache.http.impl.bootstrap.HttpServer getHttpServer()
        Returns the underlying HttpServer used to receive requests.

        Note: this method is protected for testing purposes, and should not be called by client code.

        Returns:
        the HttpServer used to receive requests

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Returns true if the JarvisServer is started, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the JarvisServer is started, false otherwise

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the underlying HttpServer.

        This method registered a shutdown hook that is used to close the HttpServer when the application terminates. To manually close the underlying HttpServer see stop().

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the underlying HttpServer.

      • registerWebhookEventProvider

        public void registerWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider webhookEventProvider)
        Register a WebhookEventProvider.

        The registered webhookEventProvider will be notified when a new request is received. If the provider supports the request content type (see WebhookEventProvider.acceptContentType(String), it will receive the request content that will be used to create the associated EventInstance.

        Parameters:
        webhookEventProvider - the WebhookEventProvider to register
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided webhookEventProvider is null
        See Also:
        notifyWebhookEventProviders(String, Object, Header[]), WebhookEventProvider.acceptContentType(String), WebhookEventProvider.handleContent(Object, Header[])

      • unregisterWebhookEventProvider

        public void unregisterWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider webhookEventProvider)
        Unregistered a WebhookEventProvider.

        The provided webhookEventProvider will not be notified when new request are received, and cannot be used to create EventInstances.

        Parameters:
        webhookEventProvider - the WebhookEventProvider to unregister
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided webhookEventProvider is null

      • getRegisteredWebhookEventProviders

        public Collection<WebhookEventProvider> getRegisteredWebhookEventProviders()
        Returns an unmodifiable Collection containing the registered WebhookEventProviders.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Collection containiong the registered WebhookEventProvider

      • notifyWebhookEventProviders

        public void notifyWebhookEventProviders(String contentType,
                                        Object content,
                                        org.apache.http.Header[] headers)
        Notifies the registered WebhookEventProviders that a new request has been handled.

        This method asks each registered WebhookEventProvider if it accepts the given contentType. If so, the provided content is sent to the WebhookEventProvider that will create the associated EventInstance.

        Parameters:
        contentType - the content type of the received request
        content - the content of the received request
        See Also:
        registerWebhookEventProvider(WebhookEventProvider), WebhookEventProvider.acceptContentType(String), WebhookEventProvider.handleContent(Object, Header[])
